quote: Man is distinguished from all other creatures by the faculty of laughter.
One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.
With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
Frequent and loud laughter is the characteristic of folly and ill manners.
From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
Man is distinguished from all other creatures by the faculty of laughter.
One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.
With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
Frequent and loud laughter is the characteristic of folly and ill manners.
From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
In my mind, there is no, thing so illiberal and so ill-bred as audible laughter.
In my mind, there is nothing so illiberal, and so ill-bred, as audible laughter.
In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures.
In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.
Laughter brings out the child in all of us.
Laughter does not seem to be a sin, but it leads to sin.
Laughter is a highly addictive positive contagious: if somebody starts, it's very difficult to stop.
Laughter is a tranquilizer with no side effects.
Laughter is America's most important export.
Laughter is by definition healthy.
Laughter is ever young, whereas tragedy, except the very highest of all, quickly becomes haggard.
Laughter is higher than all pain.
Laughter is inner jogging.
Laughter is much more important than applause. Applause is almost a duty. Laughter is a reward.
Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is by far the best ending for one.
Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
Laughter is the best way to make somebody's heart beat.
Laughter is the cipher key wherewith we decipher the whole man
Laughter is the closest distance between two people.
Laughter is the closest thing to the grace of God.
Laughter is the greatest weapon we have and we, as humans, use it the least.
Laughter is the shortest distance between people.
Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
Laughter is the tonic, the relief, the surcease for pain.
Laughter is, after speech, the chief thing that holds society together.
Laughter kills fear, and without fear there can be no faith. For without fear of the devil there is no need for God.
Laughter springs from the lawless part of our nature.
Laughter, and the broader category of humor, are key elements in helping us go on with our life after a loss.
Let us have wine and women, mirth and laughter. Sermons and soda water the day after.
Nobody ever died of laughter.
Not by wrath does one kill, but by laughter.
Nothing can confound a wise man more than laughter from a dunce.
Our sincerest laughter with some pain is fraught.
Present mirth hath present laughter. What's to come is still unsure.
Seven days without laughter makes one weak.
Sudden glory is the passion which makes those grimaces called laughter.
That laughter costs too much which is purchased by the sacrifice of decency.
The human race has an effective weapon and that is laughter.
The human race has but one really affective weapon, and that is laughter.
The human race has one really effective weapon, and that is laughter.
The laughter of man is more terrible than his tears, and takes more forms - hollow, heartless, mirthless, maniacal.
The malicious sneer is improperly called laughter.
The mintage of wisdom is to know that rest is rust, and that real life is love, laughter, and work.
The sense of humor has other things to do than to make itself conspicuous in the act of laughter.
The sound of laughter is like the vaulted dome of a temple of happiness.
The weeping of an heir is laughter in disguise.
There is little success where there is little laughter.
There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
There is nothing worth the wear of winning, but laughter and the love of friends.
To promote laughter without joining in it greatly heightens the effect.
Two things reduce prejudice: education and laughter.
Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods.
Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
Let there be more joy and laughter in your living.
